what: Assign ID values to distinct dataframe rows — assign_id
title: Assign ID values to distinct dataframe rows — assign_id
text: Assign sequential ID values distinct dataframe rows based variables specified vars.

title: Assign ID values to distinct dataframe rows — assign_id
code: assign_id(   df,   id_name,   prefix = NULL,   vars = colnames(df),   seq_start = 1,   digits = NULL,   promote = TRUE )

title: Assign ID values to distinct dataframe rows — assign_id
text: df dataframe. id_name name new ID variable. prefix optional prefix characters add ID values. vars variable names whose unique values new ID based . Defaults colnames(df). seq_start integer beginning ID sequence. Defaults 1. digits integer number digits ID (including leading zeros). Defaults nchar(nrow(df) + seq_start). promote logical value. TRUE, move ID column first position df.

title: Assign ID values to distinct dataframe rows — assign_id
text: dataframe.

title: Assign ID values to distinct dataframe rows — assign_id
code: df <- data.frame(   row_id = paste("r", 1:24),   a = rep(c("a", "b", "c"), times = 8),   b = c(1, 1, 2, 2),   c = c(TRUE, FALSE) )  df #>    row_id a b     c #> 1     r 1 a 1  TRUE #> 2     r 2 b 1 FALSE #> 3     r 3 c 2  TRUE #> 4     r 4 a 2 FALSE #> 5     r 5 b 1  TRUE #> 6     r 6 c 1 FALSE #> 7     r 7 a 2  TRUE #> 8     r 8 b 2 FALSE #> 9     r 9 c 1  TRUE #> 10   r 10 a 1 FALSE #> 11   r 11 b 2  TRUE #> 12   r 12 c 2 FALSE #> 13   r 13 a 1  TRUE #> 14   r 14 b 1 FALSE #> 15   r 15 c 2  TRUE #> 16   r 16 a 2 FALSE #> 17   r 17 b 1  TRUE #> 18   r 18 c 1 FALSE #> 19   r 19 a 2  TRUE #> 20   r 20 b 2 FALSE #> 21   r 21 c 1  TRUE #> 22   r 22 a 1 FALSE #> 23   r 23 b 2  TRUE #> 24   r 24 c 2 FALSE  assign_id(   df,   id_name = "id",   prefix = "id",   vars = c("a", "b", "c") ) #>      id row_id a b     c #> 3  id01    r 1 a 1  TRUE #> 9  id02    r 2 b 1 FALSE #> 23 id03    r 3 c 2  TRUE #> 5  id04    r 4 a 2 FALSE #> 11 id05    r 5 b 1  TRUE #> 17 id06    r 6 c 1 FALSE #> 7  id07    r 7 a 2  TRUE #> 13 id08    r 8 b 2 FALSE #> 19 id09    r 9 c 1  TRUE #> 1  id10   r 10 a 1 FALSE #> 15 id11   r 11 b 2  TRUE #> 21 id12   r 12 c 2 FALSE #> 4  id01   r 13 a 1  TRUE #> 10 id02   r 14 b 1 FALSE #> 24 id03   r 15 c 2  TRUE #> 6  id04   r 16 a 2 FALSE #> 12 id05   r 17 b 1  TRUE #> 18 id06   r 18 c 1 FALSE #> 8  id07   r 19 a 2  TRUE #> 14 id08   r 20 b 2 FALSE #> 20 id09   r 21 c 1  TRUE #> 2  id10   r 22 a 1 FALSE #> 16 id11   r 23 b 2  TRUE #> 22 id12   r 24 c 2 FALSE

title: Check date order — check_date_order
text: Check dates ordered earliest latest.

title: Check date order — check_date_order
text: ... Date vectors entered expected order, earliest latest.

title: Check date order — check_date_order
text: logical vector length inputs.

title: Check date order — check_date_order
text: number date vectors can checked. Elements index compared. NAs ignored.

title: Check date order — check_date_order
code: dates <- seq.Date(   as.Date("2023-01-01", "%Y-%m-%d"),   as.Date("2023-12-31", "%Y-%m-%d"),   by = "day" ) dates <- c(dates, rep(NA, times = 10))  n_rows <- 500  df <- data.frame(   d1 = sample(dates, n_rows, replace = TRUE),   d2 = sample(dates, n_rows, replace = TRUE),   d3 = sample(dates, n_rows, replace = TRUE),   d4 = sample(dates, n_rows, replace = TRUE) )  df$ordered <- check_date_order(df$d1, df$d2, df$d3, df$d4)

title: Fix column names — fix_colnames
text: Change column names snake case remove replace non-word characters.

title: Fix column names — fix_colnames
text: x vector column names.

title: Fix column names — fix_colnames
text: character vector length x.

title: Fix column names — fix_colnames
code: cols <- c(   "Messy/Unpleasant Column Names",   "checkThisCamelCase",   "Letters674next0to827654digits4",   "ordinal numbers: 1st 32nd 43rd 54th 900th",   "this&THAT",   "THIS/that",   " Hello, World!!! ",   "hyphenated-words",   "words in 'quotes' or even \"quotes\"" )  fix_colnames(cols) #> [1] "messy_or_unpleasant_column_names"         #> [2] "check_this_camel_case"                    #> [3] "letters_674_next_0_to_827654_digits_4"    #> [4] "ordinal_numbers_1st_32nd_43rd_54th_900th" #> [5] "this_and_that"                            #> [6] "this_or_that"                             #> [7] "hello_world"                              #> [8] "hyphenated_words"                         #> [9] "words_in_quotes_or_even_quotes"

title: Calculate percentage — pct
text: Calculate percentage using formula \(n * 100 / total\). Rounding done round_ties_away().

title: Calculate percentage — pct
text: n, total Numeric vectors, objects can coerced numeric vectors. lengths unequal, shorter vector must length 1 recycled. digits integer indicating number decimal (positive) whole number (zero negative) places round output. (See argument round_ties_away().)

title: Calculate percentage — pct
text: numeric vector length longer n total.

what: Round to nearest value, ties away from 0 — round_ties_away
title: Round to nearest value, ties away from 0 — round_ties_away
text: Round numbers nearest whole decimal value ties (numbers halfway two values, .e., ending 5) rounding nearest value direction away zero.

title: Round to nearest value, ties away from 0 — round_ties_away
Round to nearest value, ties away from 0 — round_ties_away
text: x numeric vector. digits integer indicating number decimal (positive) whole number (zero negative) places round x . rounding place equivalent \(1 / 10^{digits}\). 1 rounds nearest tenths place, 0 rounds nearest ones place, -1 rounds nearest tens place. (behaves digits argument base::round().)

title: Round to nearest value, ties away from 0 — round_ties_away
text: numeric vector length x.

title: Round to nearest value, ties away from 0 — round_ties_away
text: base::round() rounds numbers using "ties even" method, resulting round(1.5) round(2.5) evaluating 2. method attempts counteract bias data sets include numbers already rounded using "ties away 0" method (see links detail). Alternatively, round_ties_away() rounds numbers using "ties away 0" method, resulting round_ties_away(1.5) evaluating 2 round_ties_away(2.5) evaluating 3. may preferred scenarios, e.g., presenting results. Code function copied janitor::round_half_up() (version 2.2.0), copied Stack Overflow forum (see link ). Resources: Wikipedia entry Rounding Stack Overflow discussion early source function code

title: Round to nearest value, ties away from 0 — round_ties_away

what: Use an RMD template from this package — use_rmd_template
title: Use an RMD template from this package — use_rmd_template
text: wrapper rmarkdown::draft(). default, copies relevant files "nb1" RMD template scripts/ folder (created setup_project_structure()).

title: Use an RMD template from this package — use_rmd_template
Use an RMD template from this package — use_rmd_template
text: filename file name script. template name RMD template (defaults "nb1"). dir destination directory (defaults "scripts").

title: Use an RMD template from this package — use_rmd_template
text: filename (invisibly).

title: Use an RMD template from this package — use_rmd_template
text: R Notebook template nb1 three related files. _output.yml contains YAML options html_notebook. shared markdown documents directory (see Shared Options, R Markdown: Definitive Guide). render.R contains call rmarkdown::render() prepopulated execute notebook save .nb.html report project's output/ directory (created setup_project_structure()). skeleton.Rmd R Notebook file. use_rmd_template() executed, file saved name specified filename argument.

title: Use an RMD template from this package — use_rmd_template
